DataElement.preferredName: Data Monitoring Committee Responsibility Document Version Publisher Author Reference Text ISO21090.ED.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A key document that, together with the study protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), prospectively defines the study's Data Monitoring Committee (DMC) infrastructure and, in particular, the DMC's responsibilities; stipulates who sees blinded results and who sees unblinded results; and establishes a method for communication between the DMC and the sponsor. A text block containing publishing and authoring information that allows receivers of this document version to refer appropriately to this document version. EXAMPLE(S): Good Health Hospital IRB Minutes, 18-Jan-2008.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Data Monitoring Committee Responsibility Document Version Publisher Author Reference Text
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it).:A group delegated to consider some matter; a self-constituted organization to promote something.:A duty, obligation, or burden; something for which one is responsible.:A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A person or firm engaged in publishing periodicals or books or music.:The writer of a book, article, or other text.:A note acknowledging a source of information or quoting a passage.:The words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.
The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it).
A group delegated to consider matters concerning clinical studies or trials.
A duty, obligation, or burden; something for which one is responsible.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

The writer of a book, article, or other text.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Data only for human interpretation or machine processing.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
